name: unsown
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If land is unsown, or if seeds are unsown, seeds have not been put in or on the ground: Farmers were encouraged to plough land and leave it unsown. The plots were weeded to control unsown species. Related word
sow
More examplesFewer examplesHe left a six-yard strip unsown, unfertilized, and unsprayed.They campaigned for field margins to be left unsown or at least unsprayed.It was common for the farmers to sublet land (prepared, manured, but unsown or unplanted) to their seasonal labourers as part of their wage.The open space can become invaded by unsown weed and grass species.Other unsown grass species were separated and counted.
